questions.question_text:
An online retailer would like to utilize Journey Builder interactions for sending post-purchase communications to their customers.
What Contact Entry mode best fits this scenario?

discussion.content:
According Salesforce documentation: JOURNEY SETTINGS
Select Re-entry at any time if contacts can enter the journey multiple times before exiting. This setting admits the contact into the journey each time that contact meets filter criteria. For example, if you use a journey for a post-purchase engagement, you can allow contacts to enter the journey whenever they make a purchase. After you select this option and activate the journey, you can change the option to Re-entry only after exiting after creating another version.

Selected Answer: C
C. Re-entry anytime
bad question, i think its c

questions.question_text:
An employee in a customer's IT department is responsible for maintaining the Login IP Whitelist and SFTP locations in Marketing Cloud. The IT Director has asked that this employee be given the minimum permissions necessary to complete only these tasks.
How should the Consultant configure the IT employee's account?

discussion.content: Not A this role allow all admin permitions, best choice is "D"

Classic roles can be modified (e.g Administrator role), the MC role can't (e.g MC administrator)... but for this question it's not a good practice to modify a standard role because it's will be change to all users !! so the remain answer is: ||(D.)|| because we have only on user with specific task (to do that we need to clone the admin role and remove additional permissions).
I think it's D bc Permissions for MC roles can't be modified.

choices.B: Marketing Cloud Security Administrator role with account-wide access
choices.D: Custom role with limited Administrator permissions enabled
choices.A: Administrator role, with all Content and Subscriber permissions disabled
choices.C: Data Manager role with access to only the Parent Business Unit

questions.question_text:
A retail company's database of record resides at a third party company that also keeps track of purchase history. Their database only updates once a day where new records can be created and merged. The database uses the unique identified "Customer ID".
The company wants to send real-time Welcome emails to newly registered website users who provide their email address in exchange for getting 10% off their first order, and ensure this send is connected to "Customer ID" in the database.
What three key issues should be addressed? (Choose three.)

Northern Trail Outfitters stores birthdate on the contact object in the Salesforce CRM. They want to inject the contact into a journey on their birthday.
Which two Journey Builder entry process configurations allow for an injection using the customer's birthday? (Choose two.)

choices.A: An automation with query activity using Contact object Synchronized Data Extension then Journey Entry Activity
choices.B: Journey Builder Date Based Event using Contact Data related to Synchronized Data Source Attribute Group
choices.D: Salesforce Data Entry event with filter criteria on Contact Object where 'Date of Birthday equal to Today'
choices.C: DMP Entry Event from Audience Studio using Date of Birthday equal to Today Segmentation

discussion.content: D is incorrect, since Salesforce Data Entry Event typically triggers on record changes or specific events rather than continuously checking for a date.
D doesn't work in Journey Builder. You can't use a dynamic date as entry data source in Journey builder.

comments.content: CD are only correct as Journey Builder doesn’t support Synchronized DE
